result.execSummary:
The defendant Robin J Irwin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Bond money applied to court costs.

Any and all other counseling deemed appropriate by DOC.
No contact w/ Cindy Hunt or Edward Tregenza. Not to be within 1 mile of the Elm Street Court Apartments in Spooner, WI

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robin J Irwin

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Robin J Irwin in court with attorney Christopher J. Cherella.  Defendant Robin J Irwin in custody.  Thomas H Frost appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls case and appearances.  Sentencing in 15 CF 58 & 15 CF 100.  No additions or corrections from the state. 2 minor corrections from Atty Cherella re: the PSI.  State speaks re: sentencing.  Atty Cherealla speaks to the court re: sentencing. Court speaks to the defendant. Defendant speaks to the court. State speaks to the court. Atty Cherella speaks to the court and to his defendant.  Court speaks to the parties. 

4 years probation concurrent with each case.
Condition--Any and all counseling deemed appropriate.  315 Days Jail, credit 301 days credit. + court costs.  DNA Surcharge.  
No contact and not to be a mile with in Elm Street Ct. Apartments or Cindy Hunt. Edward Tragenza.


Court calls the closed cases in Mr. Irwin's files-State filed a motion re: bond.  Total amount in bond is $23,000.00. State makes statement. Atty Cherella speaks to the court. Court speaks to the parties.   Court orders that $2500 in 15 CF 70  be forfeited.  Remainder to be applied to court costs and then refunded.

Defendant Robin J Irwin in court with attorney Christopher J. Cherella.  Defendant Robin J Irwin in custody.  Thomas H Frost appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls cases and appearances.  Defendant to plea to 15 CF 58 and 15 CF 100. State speaks to the court.  Court speaks to the parties.  
Court questions the def. re: plea questionaire and waiver of rights form. Court finds the def. freely and knowingly waives his rights. Court finds there is a factual basis.

15 CF 58--Def. pleas no contest. Court accepts plea and finds the def. guilty. 

15 CF 100--Def. pleas no contest. Court accepts plea and finds the def. guilty.

All other cases dismissed but read-in.  Including the uncharged incident that Spooner PD has pending.  

Court orders a PSI. 

Jury trial off for March 11th--Bail will continue.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 25, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

Status conference at 02-29-2016 09:00 am.
Status conference at 03-11-2016 08:15 am.
Status conferences set: 2/29 at 9 am and 3/11 at 8:15 am

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt:
State of Wisconsin vs. Robin Irwin
Atty Christopher J. Cherella appears with Mr. Robin-Def. appears in custody.
Thomas H. Frost appears for the State of Wisconsin
15 TR 343, 15 TR 566, 15 CF 89, 15 CF 88, 15 CF 75, 15 CF 70, 15 CF 100, 15 CF 58, 15 CF 71, 15 CF 60

Court calls case and appearances. All felony files set for preliminary hearings. 
15 CF 58- State calls Officer Trevor Peterson to the stand. Clerk swears in Officer Peterson.  State begins questioning Officer Peterson.  Court finds that the officer has identified the def.  State continues questioning.  No further questions from the State.  Cross by Atty Cherella.  Obj-Sustained.  Obj over-ruled.  Atty Cherella continues questioning. Obj-sustained.  Atty Cherella continues questioning. No further questions. Atty Cherella.  Argument from the state. Argument from Atty Cherella.  Atty Cherella makes a motion to dismiss.  Motion is denied. Court finds there is probable cause. State offers information.  Arraignmentwaived reading. Not guilty plea is entered.
In all files-substitution by September 25th close of business. Defense motions in all files by November 20th. 
15 CF 70- State calls Officer Trevor Peterson to the stand.  Clerk swears in Officer Peterson.  State begins questioning. No further questions from the state. Cross from -Atty Cherella.   Nothing further from Atty Cherella.  Re-direct from the state. Re-cross.   Argument from Atty Cherella.  Court finds there is probable cause.  State offers information.  Arraignment-waived reading. Not guilty plea is entered. 
15 CF 88- State calls Officer Trevor Peterson to the stand.  Clerk swears in Officer Peterson.  State begins questioning. No further questions from the state. Cross from Atty-Cherella.  Nothing further.  Court finds there is probable cause.  State offers information. Arraignment-Waived reading. Not guilty plea is entered. 
15 CF 60- State calls Officer Trevor Peterson to the stand.  Clerk swears in Officer Peterson.  State begins questioning. No further questions from the state. Cross from Atty Cherella. Nothing further. Witness is excused.  Argument from the state. Argument from Atty Cherella.   Court finds there is probable cause. State offers information.  Arraignment-Waived reading. Not guilty plea is entered.  
15 CF 71-State calls Cpt Steve Pank to the stand. Clerk swears in Cpt. Pank. State begins questioning. No further questions from the state.  Cross from Atty Cherella.  No argument.  Court finds there is probable cause.  State offers information. Arraignment-Waived reading. Not guilty plea is entered.  
Recess at 3:30pm

Back on the record at 3:35pm
15 CF 75- State calls Cpt Steve Pank to the stand. Cpt. Pank is still under oath. State begins questioning. No further questions from the state.  Cross from Atty Cherella.  No argument.  Court finds there is probable cause.  State offers information. Arraignment-Waived reading. Not guilty plea is entered.   
15 CF 89- State calls Cpt Steve Pank to the stand. Cpt. Pank is still under oath. State begins questioning. No further questions from the state.  Cross from Atty Cherella.  Argument from Atty Cherella.  Court finds there is probable cause.  State offers information. Arraignment-Waived reading. Not guilty plea is entered.   
15 CF 100- State calls Cpt Steve Pank to the stand. Cpt. Pank is still under oath. State begins questioning. No further questions from the state. No- Cross from Atty Cherella.  Witness is excused. No Argument.  Court finds there is probable cause.  State offers information. Arraignment-Waived reading. Not guilty plea is entered.   
Traffic files will track w/ felony files.  

11:00am Telephone Status Conference  11/20/15

Defendant Robin J Irwin in court with attorney Christopher J. Cherella.  Defendant Robin J Irwin in custody.  Thomas H Frost appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls case and appearances.  Status on all files.  15 CF 58, 60, 70, 71, 75, 88, 89,100  15 TR 343 & 566.
15 CF 100 Initial Appearance- Waive reading in that file.
Atty Cherella speaks to the court.  Court orders Mr. Irwin to return the eval to the jail staff.  Atty Frost speaks to the court.  Court receives Dr. Minter's report-It will stay in a sealed file.  Court reads evaluation w/ the parties. Court accepts report. 
Atty Cherella speaks to the court regarding his bail reduction motion in 15 CF 75 and 15 CF 100.    Court speaks to the parties. Atty Frost speaks to the court. Atty Cherella speaks to the court.   Court grants motion in 15 CF 75--Reducing from $25,000 to $10,000---$15,000 of bail proceeds to cover retainer of Mr. Cherella. 
Motion in 15 CF 100--Motion is denied.  
Atty Cherella waives time limits for pre-lim.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 12, 2015 at 02:15 pm.
